org.sxb.http.converter.json

クラス MappingJackson2HttpMessageConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sxb.http.converter.AbstractHttpMessageConverter<java.lang.Object>
      • org.sxb.http.converter.json.AbstractJackson2HttpMessageConverter
        • org.sxb.http.converter.json.MappingJackson2HttpMessageConverter
  • すべての実装されたインタフェース:
    GenericHttpMessageConverter<java.lang.Object>, HttpMessageConverter<java.lang.Object>

    public class MappingJackson2HttpMessageConverter
extends AbstractJackson2HttpMessageConverter
    Implementation of HttpMessageConverter that can read and write JSON using Jackson 2.x's ObjectMapper.

    This converter can be used to bind to typed beans, or untyped HashMap instances.

    By default, this converter supports application/json and application/*+json. This can be overridden by setting the supportedMediaTypes property.

    The default constructor uses the default configuration provided by Jackson2ObjectMapperBuilder.

    Compatible with Jackson 2.1 and higher.

    導入されたバージョン:
    2.0
    作成者:
    Arjen Poutsma, Jeffson

    • メソッドの詳細

      • setJsonPrefix

        public void setJsonPrefix(java.lang.String jsonPrefix)
        Specify a custom prefix to use for this view's JSON output. Default is none.
        関連項目:
        setPrefixJson(boolean)

      • setPrefixJson

        public void setPrefixJson(boolean prefixJson)
        Indicate whether the JSON output by this view should be prefixed with "{} %26%26". Default is false.

        Prefixing the JSON string in this manner is used to help prevent JSON Hijacking. The prefix renders the string syntactically invalid as a script so that it cannot be hijacked. This prefix does not affect the evaluation of JSON, but if JSON validation is performed on the string, the prefix would need to be ignored.

        関連項目:
        setJsonPrefix(java.lang.String)
